title: Capezzana 2009 Riserva  (Vin Santo di Carmignano)
description: The nose of this 90% Trebbiano and 10% San Colombano wine suggests dried apricot, chestnut honey and marzipan. Its rich flavors carry over to a sweet, luscious finish.

title: Carpineto 2009 Poggio Sant'Ercolano  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Forest floor, sun-baked soil, mature plum and new oak aromas lead the nose. The assertive, structured palate shows star anise, espresso and dried black cherry flavors, braced by medium-grained tannins that carry the finish.

title: Clos la Madeleine 2016 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. There is power here, with dark tannins and immense swathes of black fruits. The fruit and the juicy acidity need to be allowed to show through all the tannic structure and palate concentration.

title: Corte dei Venti 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: This opens with subdued toast, espresso, scorched earth and underbrush aromas, while the chewy palate offers dried black cherry, licorice, vanilla and coffee notes. Assertive, close-grained tannins carry the finish.

title: Domaine Charles Baur 2015 Rouge d'Alsace Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Gentle glints of raspberry are hinted at on the nose. The palate does not quite follow up but is totally light and crunchy. The midpalate reveals some warmth and depth along with more berry aromas. This is bone dry, fresh, aromatic and slender. Ideal for a picnic basket or for serving chilled.

title: Domaine de Saint-Guirons 2013  Pauillac
description: This blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon with Merlot comes from a small parcel of vineyards owned by the Borie family, which also has two Pauillac-classed growths. This wine is neat and finely formed with crisp fruit and attractive acidity. The tannins give support rather than domination. Drink from 2020.

title: Casina di Cornia 2011 Vigna La Casina Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This wine's new leather, menthol, steeped prune and French oak aromas seemingly fill the glass to brimming. The firmly structured palate offers dried Morello cherry, chopped mint and licorice flavors framed by bracing, close-grained tannins.

title: Castelli Martinozzi 2015  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Wild red berry, new leather and violet scents take center stage in this bright, young red. The palate is taut and linear, offering crushed raspberry, dried cherry, sage and clove notes, while fine-grained tannins provide the framework.

title: Château Blaignan 2014  Médoc
description: This 240-acre property has produced a ripe, smooth and fruity wine. With layers of tannins under the juicy blackberry flavors, it is already balanced and likely to be approachable soon. There is a lively edge of acidity to keep everything crisp. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Destieux 2016 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Dry spice aromas lead to a panoply of wood on the nose and moouth. The fruit is very subdued in this wine. Time will tell if the potential of the black fruits overcomes the assertive wood characters.

title: Château la Clotte 2014  Saint-Émilion
description: This is the first vintage of this property under the ownership of Château Ausone. The wine has a solid structure and firm tannins that offer rich fruit. It is balanced, full of tannins and with fine acidity as well as bold red fruits. Drink from 2023.

title: Abacela 2013 Barrel Select Syrah (Umpqua Valley)
description: Spicy and aromatic, this displays an aggressive streak of vanilla extract, perhaps from aging in one-quarter new French oak. Past that it opens into lush black-cherry fruit, with a lingering, concentrated finish.

title: Abacela 2014 Barrel Select Garnacha (Umpqua Valley)
description: The minerality jumps out here, in both the aroma and the palate presence. Cranberry fruit, a touch of nutmeg, and a finish that is quite astringent complete the picture.

title: Andis 2013 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This wine has a unique, earthy fig aroma and flavor, full body and a broad, mouth-filling texture. Its slight rustic character is interesting to explore and doesn't overwhelm the palate. An enjoyable and different expression that's also reasonably priced.

title: Andis 2014 Hawk Creek Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)
description: Dark fruit flavors with a welcome sense of ripeness make this full-bodied wine feel generous and easy on the palate. It has soft tannins that let its black plum and blueberry flavors fan out and linger on the finish.

title: Badia di Morrona 2012 N'Antia Red (Toscana)
description: This 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Cabernet Franc and 20% Merlot blend has herb-laced blackberry aromas. The dense palate doles out raspberry jam, toast and clove flavors through close-grained tannins that grip the finish. Drink through 2018.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2011 Faustino V Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Berry and plum aromas are so ripe that raisin enters the picture. This feels medium to full, with soft acidity. Flavors of chocolate and wood spice share space with ripe berry fruit, while a full, long finish deals mocha and raisin notes.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2010 Cerro Añon Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Gritty cassis aromas are oaky and challenging, which is what you can get when a wine spends more than three years in oak. In the mouth, this is wiry and rubbery. Foxy plum and cherry flavors finish clampy and herbal. Very good but with a few holes and pitfalls.

title: Domaines Schlumberger 2015 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: The nose just hints at earth and autumnal oak leaf. The palate comes with slight grip, very fine tannins and more earthy leafy aromas. Red-cherry fruit is just hinted at. This is slender and bone dry and will come into its own when served with subtle mushroom or game dishes.

title: Folie à Deux 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Approachable in its youthful vigor and wealth of fruit, this medium-bodied coastal wine offers a complement of spicy black licorice, cranberry and strawberry, finishing lean and focused.

title: Glen Manor 2013 Hodder Hill Red (Virginia)
description: Fresh scents of cranberry and raspberry mingle with charred oak on the nose. Flavors of jammy plum, cassis, pipe tobacco and cedar are luscious, but are framed by smooth tannins and fresh acidity. The finish is long, dry and toasty, with a burst of spice at the end.

title: Spindrift Cellars 2013 Woodhall Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The oak peeks through, set against proportionate strawberry and cherry fruit which has been lightly ripened. It's not a big wine, but it is balanced, and was barrel-aged for 18 months in a percentage of French oak. It should drink well now through 2022.

title: Pagani de Marchi 2012 Principe Guerriero Sangiovese (Montescudaio)
description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, this opens with black cherry, white pepper and an earthy underbrush scents. The savory, straightforward palate shows plum, clove and tobacco notes, set against chewy tannins. Enjoy through 2019.

title: Paradisone 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: This opens with ripe dark-skinned berry, underbrush and baking spice aromas, while the dense, robust palate offers black cherry jam, clove and licorice flavors. It's already accessible, with fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Rocky Point 2013 La Colina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This mixes darker shades of berry and cherry fruit, with a streak of tobacco and well-managed tannins. It's polished and carries moderate weight through the finish.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is a thorough exploration of Chardonnay, leading with vanilla, apple, buttercream and baking spice aromas. The palate rides lemony acidity into seared apple and nectarine flavors, finishing on marzipan and a citrus tang.

title: Grattamacco 2014 L'Alberello  (Bolgheri Superiore)
description: Black-skinned berry, cedar and espresso scents lead the nose of this blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot. The firm palate delivers blackberry, and licorice flavors and a toasted note, set against assertive tannins. Enjoy through 2019.

title: PoderNuovo a Palazzone 2012 Therra Red (Toscana)
description: Made of 48% Sangiovese, 35% Montepulciano, 10% Merlot and 7% Cabernet Sauvignon, this has black-skinned fruit and baking spice aromas. The firm palate delivers black cherry, black currant and tobacco notes in a frame of fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Pratesi 2013 Il Circo Rosso Riserva  (Carmignano)
description: Made of 70% Sangiovese, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Merlot, this offers black currant and vanilla aromas. The dense, approachable palate delivers ripe black plum and toasty tobacco flavors, pulled taut by firm tannins. Drink through 2019.

title: Vega Montán 2014 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Slightly rubbery black cherry and blackberry aromas are generic but good. This feels round and easygoing, with soft tannins and modest acidity. Black-plum flavors fly solo, while this is nice but hollow on the finish. Drink now.
